item.title: Ip-Ban Problems
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

Yes, that’s how I do it since my IP ban command wasn’t working as well. But just make sure that there’s a check for them. Mine is:

public int checkbannedips() { try { BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("./data/bannedips.txt")); String data = null; while ((data = in.readLine()) != null) { if (connectedFrom.equalsIgnoreCase(data)) { outStream.createFrame(999999); } } } catch (IOException e) { System.out.println("Critical error while checking banned ips!"); e.printStackTrace(); } return 0; }

Read full topic

item.title: Ip-Ban Problems
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

Check the ipbans file (.txt I would imagine). Make sure the playerLastConnect shows there. Also, make sure you have returnCode = (I forget the number) for all IPs within that text file.

item.title: Ip-Ban Problems
item.dc:creator: @StrifeScape StrifeScape
item.description:
@StrifeScape wrote:

Ok, I’ve been trying to ip ban a user from my server. So to do ::ipban (username) and kick him. He logs back in almost imediatly. So I check the client.java to see if the ipban command is there. It is, and it won’t work. Heres what it looks like:

[code]}
if (command.startsWith(“ipban”) && playerRights > 3) {
try {
String otherPName = command.substring(6);
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

                if (otherPIndex != -1) {
                    client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];

		p.writeLog(p.playerLastConnect, "ipbans");
		p.disconnected = true;

yell(" “+playerName+” has IP banned “+p.playerName+” ");
sM(“You have ipbanned “+p.playerName+”!”);
} else {
sM(“The name doesnt exist.”);
}
} catch (Exception e) {
sM(“Try entering a name you want to ip ban…”);[/code]

Please tell me how to fix this.

Read full topic
